sn42.12:1.1.pli: Atha kho rāsiyo gāmaṇi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rāsiyo gāmaṇi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn42.12:1.1.eng: Then Rāsiya the chief went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

sn42.12:1.2.pli: “sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante, ‘samaṇo gotamo sabbaṃ tapaṃ garahati, sabbaṃ tapassiṃ lūkhajīviṃ ekaṃsena upavadati upakkosatī’ti.
sn42.12:1.2.eng: “Sir, I have heard this: ‘The ascetic Gotama criticizes all forms of mortification. He categorically condemns and denounces those fervent mortifiers who live rough.’

sn42.12:1.3.pli: Ye te, bhante, evamāhaṃsu: ‘samaṇo gotamo sabbaṃ tapaṃ garahati, sabbaṃ tapassiṃ lūkhajīviṃ ekaṃsena upavadati upakkosatī’ti, kacci te, bhante, bhagavato vuttavādino, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, dhammassa cānudhammaṃ byākaronti, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchatī”ti?
sn42.12:1.3.eng: Do those who say this repeat what the Buddha has said, and not misrepresent him with an untruth? Is their explanation in line with the teaching? Are there any legitimate grounds for rebuttal and criticism?”

sn42.12:1.4.pli: “Ye te, gāmaṇi, evamāhaṃsu: ‘samaṇo gotamo sabbaṃ tapaṃ garahati, sabbaṃ tapassiṃ lūkhajīviṃ ekaṃsena upavadati upakkosatī’ti, na me te vuttavādino, abbhācikkhanti ca pana maṃ te asatā tucchā abhūtena.
sn42.12:1.4.eng: “Chief, those who say this do not repeat what I have said. They misrepresent me with what is false, hollow, and untrue.

sn42.12:2.1.pli: Dveme, gāmaṇi, antā pabbajitena na sevitabbā—
sn42.12:2.1.eng: These two extremes should not be cultivated by one who has gone forth.

sn42.12:2.2.pli: yo cāyaṃ kāmesu kāmasukhallikānuyogo hīno gammo pothujjaniko anariyo anatthasaṃhito, yo cāyaṃ attakilamathānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasaṃhito.
sn42.12:2.2.eng: Indulgence in sensual pleasures, which is low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. And indulgence in self-mortification, which is painful, ignoble, and pointless.

sn42.12:2.3.pli: Ete te, gāmaṇi, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā—cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.
sn42.12:2.3.eng: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One understood the middle way of practice, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

sn42.12:2.4.pli: Katamā ca sā, gāmaṇi, majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā—cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati?
sn42.12:2.4.eng: And what is that middle way of practice?

sn42.12:2.5.eng: It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

sn42.12:2.6.eng: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

sn42.12:2.7.pli: Ayaṃ kho sā, gāmaṇi, majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā—cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.
sn42.12:2.7.eng: This, chief, is the middle way of practice that was understood by the Realized One, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

sn42.12:3.1.pli: Tayo kho me, gāmaṇi, kāmabhogino santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
sn42.12:3.1.eng: There are these three kinds of pleasure seekers in the world.

sn42.12:3.3.pli: Idha, gāmaṇi, ekacco kāmabhogī adhammena bhoge pariyesati, sāhasena adhammena bhoge pariyesitvā sāhasena na attānaṃ sukheti na pīṇeti na saṃvibhajati na puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:3.3.eng: Take a pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using illegitimate, coercive means, and who doesn’t make themselves happy and pleased, or share it and make merit.

sn42.12:3.4.pli: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekacco kāmabhogī adhammena bhoge pariyesati sāhasena.
sn42.12:3.4.eng: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using illegitimate, coercive means.

sn42.12:3.5.pli: Adhammena bhoge pariyesitvā sāhasena attānaṃ sukheti pīṇeti, na saṃvibhajati na puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:3.5.eng: They make themselves happy and pleased, but don’t share it and make merit.

sn42.12:3.6.pli: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekacco kāmabhogī adhammena bhoge pariyesati sāhasena.
sn42.12:3.6.eng: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using illegitimate, coercive means.

sn42.12:3.7.pli: Adhammena bhoge pariyesitvā sāhasena attānaṃ sukheti pīṇeti saṃvibhajati puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:3.7.eng: They make themselves happy and pleased, and they share it and make merit.

sn42.12:4.1.pli: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekacco kāmabhogī dhammādhammena bhoge pariyesati sāhasenapi asāhasenapi.
sn42.12:4.1.eng: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using means both legitimate and illegitimate, and coercive and non-coercive.

sn42.12:4.2.pli: Dhammādhammena bhoge pariyesitvā sāhasenapi asāhasenapi na attānaṃ sukheti, na pīṇeti, na saṃvibhajati, na puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:4.2.eng: They don’t make themselves happy and pleased, or share it and make merit.

sn42.12:4.3.pli: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekacco kāmabhogī dhammādhammena bhoge pariyesati sāhasenapi asāhasenapi.
sn42.12:4.3.eng: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using means both legitimate and illegitimate, and coercive and non-coercive.

sn42.12:4.4.pli: Dhammādhammena bhoge pariyesitvā sāhasenapi asāhasenapi attānaṃ sukheti pīṇeti, na saṃvibhajati, na puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:4.4.eng: They don’t make themselves happy and pleased, or share it and make merit.

sn42.12:4.5.pli: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekacco kāmabhogī dhammādhammena bhoge pariyesati, sāhasenapi asāhasenapi.
sn42.12:4.5.eng: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using means both legitimate and illegitimate, and coercive and non-coercive.

sn42.12:4.6.pli: Dhammādhammena bhoge pariyesitvā sāhasenapi asāhasenapi attānaṃ sukheti pīṇeti saṃvibhajati puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:4.6.eng: They make themselves happy and pleased, and they share it and make merit.

sn42.12:5.1.pli: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekacco kāmabhogī dhammena bhoge pariyesati asāhasena.
sn42.12:5.1.eng: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means.

sn42.12:5.2.pli: Dhammena bhoge pariyesitvā asāhasena na attānaṃ sukheti, na pīṇeti, na saṃvibhajati, na puññāni karoti.

sn42.12:5.4.pli: Dhammena bhoge pariyesitvā asāhasena attānaṃ sukheti pīṇeti, na saṃvibhajati, na puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:5.4.eng: They make themselves happy and pleased, but don’t share it and make merit.

sn42.12:5.5.pli: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekacco kāmabhogī dhammena bhoge pariyesati asāhasena.
sn42.12:5.5.eng: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means.

sn42.12:5.6.pli: Dhammena bhoge pariyesitvā asāhasena attānaṃ sukheti pīṇeti saṃvibhajati puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:5.6.eng: They make themselves happy and pleased, and they share it and make merit.

sn42.12:5.7.pli: Te ca bhoge gadhito mucchito ajjhopanno anādīnavadassāvī anissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati.
sn42.12:5.7.eng: They enjoy that wealth tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape.

sn42.12:5.8.pli: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekacco kāmabhogī dhammena bhoge pariyesati asāhasena.
sn42.12:5.8.eng: Next, a pleasure seeker seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means.

sn42.12:5.9.pli: Dhammena bhoge pariyesitvā asāhasena attānaṃ sukheti pīṇeti saṃvibhajati puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:5.9.eng: They make themselves happy and pleased, and they share it and make merit.

sn42.12:5.10.pli: Te ca bhoge agadhito amucchito anajjhopanno ādīnavadassāvī nissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati.
sn42.12:5.10.eng: And they enjoy that wealth untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape.

sn42.12:6.1.pli: Tatra, gāmaṇi, yvāyaṃ kāmabhogī adhammena bhoge pariyesati sāhasena, adhammena bhoge pariyesitvā sāhasena na attānaṃ sukheti, na pīṇeti, na saṃvibhajati, na puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:6.1.eng: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using illegitimate, coercive means, and who doesn’t make themselves happy and pleased, or share it and make merit.

sn42.12:6.2.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, kāmabhogī tīhi ṭhānehi gārayho.
sn42.12:6.2.eng: They may be criticized on three grounds.

sn42.12:6.4.pli: Adhammena bhoge pariyesati sāhasenāti, iminā paṭhamena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:6.4.eng: They seek wealth using illegitimate, coercive means. This is the first ground for criticism.

sn42.12:6.5.eng: They don’t make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for criticism.

sn42.12:13.1.pli: Tatra, gāmaṇi, yvāyaṃ kāmabhogī dhammena bhoge pariyesati asāhasena, dhammena bhoge pariyesitvā asāhasena attānaṃ sukheti pīṇeti, na saṃvibhajati, na puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:13.1.eng: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased, but doesn’t share it and make merit.

sn42.12:13.2.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, kāmabhogī dvīhi ṭhānehi pāsaṃso, ekena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:13.2.eng: This pleasure seeker may be praised on two grounds, and criticized on one.

sn42.12:13.3.eng: What are the two grounds for praise?

sn42.12:13.4.pli: Dhammena bhoge pariyesati asāhasenāti, iminā paṭhamena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:13.4.eng: They seek wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means. This is the first ground for praise.

sn42.12:13.5.pli: Attānaṃ sukheti pīṇetīti, iminā dutiyena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:13.5.eng: They make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for praise.

sn42.12:13.6.eng: What is the one ground for criticism?

sn42.12:13.7.pli: Na saṃvibhajati, na puññāni karotīti, iminā ekena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:13.7.eng: They don’t share it and make merit. This is the one ground for criticism.

sn42.12:13.8.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, kāmabhogī imehi dvīhi ṭhānehi pāsaṃso, iminā ekena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:13.8.eng: This pleasure seeker may be praised on these two grounds, and criticized on this one.

sn42.12:14.1.pli: Tatra, gāmaṇi, yvāyaṃ kāmabhogī dhammena bhoge pariyesati asāhasena, dhammena bhoge pariyesitvā asāhasena attānaṃ sukheti pīṇeti saṃvibhajati puññāni karoti, te ca bhoge gadhito mucchito ajjhopanno anādīnavadassāvī anissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati.
sn42.12:14.1.eng: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased, and shares it and makes merit. But they enjoy that wealth tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape.

sn42.12:14.2.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, kāmabhogī tīhi ṭhānehi pāsaṃso, ekena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:14.2.eng: They may be praised on three grounds and criticized on one.

sn42.12:14.3.eng: What are the three grounds for praise?

sn42.12:14.4.pli: Dhammena bhoge pariyesati asāhasenāti, iminā paṭhamena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:14.4.eng: They seek wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means. This is the first ground for praise.

sn42.12:14.5.pli: Attānaṃ sukheti pīṇetīti, iminā dutiyena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:14.5.eng: They make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for praise.

sn42.12:14.6.pli: Saṃvibhajati puññāni karotīti, iminā tatiyena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:14.6.eng: They share it and make merit. This is the third ground for praise.

sn42.12:14.7.eng: What is the one ground for criticism?

sn42.12:14.8.pli: Te ca bhoge gadhito mucchito ajjhopanno anādīnavadassāvī anissaraṇapañño paribhuñjatīti, iminā ekena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:14.8.eng: They enjoy that wealth tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape. This is the one ground for criticism.

sn42.12:14.9.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, kāmabhogī imehi tīhi ṭhānehi pāsaṃso, iminā ekena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:14.9.eng: This pleasure seeker may be praised on these three grounds, and criticized on this one.

sn42.12:15.1.pli: Tatra, gāmaṇi, yvāyaṃ kāmabhogī dhammena bhoge pariyesati asāhasena, dhammena bhoge pariyesitvā asāhasena attānaṃ sukheti pīṇeti saṃvibhajati puññāni karoti.
sn42.12:15.1.eng: Now, consider the pleasure seeker who seeks wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means, and who makes themselves happy and pleased, and shares it and makes merit.

sn42.12:15.2.pli: Te ca bhoge agadhito amucchito anajjhopanno ādīnavadassāvī nissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati.
sn42.12:15.2.eng: And they enjoy that wealth untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape.

sn42.12:15.3.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, kāmabhogī catūhi ṭhānehi pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:15.3.eng: This pleasure seeker may be praised on four grounds.

sn42.12:15.4.eng: What are the four grounds for praise?

sn42.12:15.5.pli: Dhammena bhoge pariyesati asāhasenāti, iminā paṭhamena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:15.5.eng: They seek wealth using legitimate, non-coercive means. This is the first ground for praise.

sn42.12:15.6.pli: Attānaṃ sukheti pīṇetīti, iminā dutiyena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:15.6.eng: They make themselves happy and pleased. This is the second ground for praise.

sn42.12:15.7.pli: Saṃvibhajati puññāni karotīti, iminā tatiyena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:15.7.eng: They share it and make merit. This is the third ground for praise.

sn42.12:15.8.pli: Te ca bhoge agadhito amucchito anajjhopanno ādīnavadassāvī nissaraṇapañño paribhuñjatīti, iminā catutthena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:15.8.eng: They enjoy that wealth untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape. This is the fourth ground for praise.

sn42.12:15.9.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, kāmabhogī imehi catūhi ṭhānehi pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:15.9.eng: This pleasure seeker may be praised on these four grounds.

sn42.12:16.1.pli: Tayome, gāmaṇi, tapassino lūkhajīvino santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
sn42.12:16.1.eng: These three fervent mortifiers who live rough are found in the world.

sn42.12:16.3.pli: Idha, gāmaṇi, ekacco tapassī lūkhajīvī saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti:
sn42.12:16.3.eng: Take a fervent mortifier who has gone forth out of faith from the lay life to homelessness, thinking:

sn42.12:16.4.pli: ‘appeva nāma kusalaṃ dhammaṃ adhigaccheyyaṃ, appeva nāma uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ sacchikareyyan’ti.
sn42.12:16.4.eng: ‘Hopefully I will achieve a skillful quality! Hopefully I will realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones!’

sn42.12:16.5.pli: So attānaṃ ātāpeti paritāpeti, kusalañca dhammaṃ nādhigacchati, uttari ca manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ na sacchikaroti.
sn42.12:16.5.eng: They mortify and torment themselves. But they don’t achieve any skillful quality, or realize any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.

sn42.12:17.1.pli: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekacco tapassī lūkhajīvī saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti:
sn42.12:17.1.eng: Take another fervent mortifier who has gone forth out of faith from the lay life to homelessness, thinking:

sn42.12:17.2.pli: ‘appeva nāma kusalaṃ dhammaṃ adhigaccheyyaṃ, appeva nāma uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ sacchikareyyan’ti.
sn42.12:17.2.eng: ‘Hopefully I will achieve a skillful quality! Hopefully I will realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones!’

sn42.12:17.3.pli: So attānaṃ ātāpeti paritāpeti, kusalañhi kho dhammaṃ adhigacchati, uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ na sacchikaroti.
sn42.12:17.3.eng: They mortify and torment themselves. And they achieve a skillful quality, but don’t realize any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.

sn42.12:18.1.pli: Idha pana, gāmaṇi, ekacco tapassī lūkhajīvī saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti:
sn42.12:18.1.eng: Take another fervent mortifier who has gone forth out of faith from the lay life to homelessness, thinking:

sn42.12:18.2.pli: ‘appeva nāma kusalaṃ dhammaṃ adhigaccheyyaṃ, appeva nāma uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ sacchikareyyan’ti.
sn42.12:18.2.eng: ‘Hopefully I will achieve a skillful quality! Hopefully I will realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones!’

sn42.12:18.3.pli: So attānaṃ ātāpeti paritāpeti, kusalañca dhammaṃ adhigacchati, uttari ca manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ sacchikaroti.
sn42.12:18.3.eng: They mortify and torment themselves. And they achieve a skillful quality, and they realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.

sn42.12:19.1.pli: Tatra, gāmaṇi, yvāyaṃ tapassī lūkhajīvī attānaṃ ātāpeti paritāpeti, kusalañca dhammaṃ nādhigacchati, uttari ca manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ na sacchikaroti. Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, tapassī lūkhajīvī tīhi ṭhānehi gārayho.
sn42.12:19.1.eng: In this case, the first fervent mortifier may be criticized on three grounds.

sn42.12:19.3.pli: Attānaṃ ātāpeti paritāpetīti, iminā paṭhamena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:19.3.eng: They mortify and torment themselves. This is the first ground for criticism.

sn42.12:19.4.pli: Kusalañca dhammaṃ nādhigacchatīti, iminā dutiyena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:19.4.eng: They don’t achieve a skillful quality. This is the second ground for criticism.

sn42.12:19.5.pli: Uttari ca manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ na sacchikarotīti, iminā tatiyena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:19.5.eng: They don’t realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones. This is the third ground for criticism.

sn42.12:19.6.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, tapassī lūkhajīvī, imehi tīhi ṭhānehi gārayho.
sn42.12:19.6.eng: This fervent mortifier may be criticized on these three grounds.

sn42.12:20.1.pli: Tatra, gāmaṇi, yvāyaṃ tapassī lūkhajīvī attānaṃ ātāpeti paritāpeti, kusalañhi kho dhammaṃ adhigacchati, uttari ca manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ na sacchikaroti.
sn42.12:20.1.eng: In this case, the second fervent mortifier

sn42.12:20.2.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, tapassī lūkhajīvī dvīhi ṭhānehi gārayho, ekena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:20.2.eng: may be criticized on two grounds, and praised on one.

sn42.12:20.3.eng: What are the two grounds for criticism?

sn42.12:20.4.pli: Attānaṃ ātāpeti paritāpetīti, iminā paṭhamena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:20.4.eng: They mortify and torment themselves. This is the first ground for criticism.

sn42.12:20.5.pli: Uttari ca manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ na sacchikarotīti, iminā dutiyena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:20.5.eng: They don’t realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones. This is the second ground for criticism.

sn42.12:20.6.eng: What is the one ground for praise?

sn42.12:20.7.pli: Kusalañhi kho dhammaṃ adhigacchatīti, iminā ekena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:20.7.eng: They achieve a skillful quality. This is the one ground for praise.

sn42.12:20.8.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, tapassī lūkhajīvī imehi dvīhi ṭhānehi gārayho, iminā ekena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:20.8.eng: This fervent mortifier may be criticized on these two grounds, and praised on one.

sn42.12:21.1.pli: Tatra, gāmaṇi, yvāyaṃ tapassī lūkhajīvī attānaṃ ātāpeti paritāpeti, kusalañca dhammaṃ adhigacchati, uttari ca manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ sacchikaroti. Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, tapassī lūkhajīvī ekena ṭhānena gārayho, dvīhi ṭhānehi pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:21.1.eng: In this case, the third fervent mortifier may be criticized on one ground, and praised on two.

sn42.12:21.2.eng: What is the one ground for criticism?

sn42.12:21.3.pli: Attānaṃ ātāpeti paritāpetīti, iminā ekena ṭhānena gārayho.
sn42.12:21.3.eng: They mortify and torment themselves. This is the one ground for criticism.

sn42.12:21.4.eng: What are the two grounds for praise?

sn42.12:21.5.pli: Kusalañca dhammaṃ adhigacchatīti, iminā paṭhamena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:21.5.eng: They achieve a skillful quality. This is the first ground for praise.

sn42.12:21.6.pli: Uttari ca manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ sacchikarotīti, iminā dutiyena ṭhānena pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:21.6.eng: They realize a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones. This is the second ground for praise.

sn42.12:21.7.pli: Ayaṃ, gāmaṇi, tapassī lūkhajīvī iminā ekena ṭhānena gārayho, imehi dvīhi ṭhānehi pāsaṃso.
sn42.12:21.7.eng: This fervent mortifier may be criticized on this one ground, and praised on two.

sn42.12:22.1.pli: Tisso imā, gāmaṇi, sandiṭṭhikā nijjarā akālikā ehipassikā opaneyyikā paccattaṃ veditabbā viññūhi.
sn42.12:22.1.eng: There are these three kinds of wearing away that are apparent in the present life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know them for themselves.

sn42.12:22.3.pli: Yaṃ ratto rāgādhikaraṇaṃ attabyābādhāyapi ceteti, parabyābādhāyapi ceteti, ubhayabyābādhāyapi ceteti.
sn42.12:22.3.eng: A greedy person, because of greed, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both.

sn42.12:22.4.pli: Rāge pahīne nevattabyābādhāya ceteti, na parabyābādhāya ceteti, na ubhayabyābādhāya ceteti.
sn42.12:22.4.eng: When they’ve given up greed they don’t have such intentions.

sn42.12:22.5.pli: Sandiṭṭhikā nijjarā akālikā ehipassikā opaneyyikā paccattaṃ veditabbā viññūhi.
sn42.12:22.5.eng: This wearing away is apparent in the present life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.

sn42.12:22.6.pli: Yaṃ duṭṭho dosādhikaraṇaṃ attabyābādhāyapi ceteti, parabyābādhāyapi ceteti, ubhayabyābādhāyapi ceteti.
sn42.12:22.6.eng: A hateful person, because of hate, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both.

sn42.12:22.7.pli: Dose pahīne nevattabyābādhāya ceteti, na parabyābādhāya ceteti, na ubhayabyābādhāya ceteti.
sn42.12:22.7.eng: When they’ve given up hate they don’t have such intentions.

sn42.12:22.8.pli: Sandiṭṭhikā nijjarā akālikā ehipassikā opaneyyikā paccattaṃ veditabbā viññūhi.
sn42.12:22.8.eng: This wearing away is apparent in the present life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.

sn42.12:22.9.pli: Yaṃ mūḷho mohādhikaraṇaṃ attabyābādhāyapi ceteti, parabyābādhāyapi ceteti, ubhayabyābādhāyapi ceteti.
sn42.12:22.9.eng: A deluded person, because of delusion, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both.

sn42.12:22.10.pli: Mohe pahīne nevattabyābādhāya ceteti, na parabyābādhāya ceteti, na ubhayabyābādhāya ceteti.
sn42.12:22.10.eng: When they’ve given up delusion they don’t have such intentions.

sn42.12:22.11.pli: Sandiṭṭhikā nijjarā akālikā ehipassikā opaneyyikā paccattaṃ veditabbā viññūhi.
sn42.12:22.11.eng: This wearing away is apparent in the present life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.

sn42.12:22.12.pli: Imā kho, gāmaṇi, tisso sandiṭṭhikā nijjarā akālikā ehipassikā opaneyyikā paccattaṃ veditabbā viññūhī”ti.
sn42.12:22.12.eng: These are the three kinds of wearing away that are apparent in the present life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know them for themselves.”

sn42.12:23.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, rāsiyo gāmaṇi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn42.12:23.1.eng: When he said this, Rāsiya the chief said to the Buddha,

sn42.12:23.3.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
sn42.12:23.3.eng: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
